result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 14CF348 & 15CF114. Defendant Francis S. Bucsko in court with attorney Kathleen Mary Gionis.  Defendant Francis S. Bucsko in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:58 am.  Gionis will be requesting psychological eval thru PD office for the PSI.
No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
15CF114-Count 1-with enhancer-NC plea.  Count 3-AMENDED to felony bail jumping (STRIKING repeater)-NC plea.  Amended Information to be filed.  CT accepts pleas, adj guilty & judgment entered.  
Remaining counts including 14CF348-DRI for sentencing.  Pursuant to agreement - Washburn county case #16CF24 is to be DRI as well.
Order PSI, long form.  Agent does not need to be present.  PSI due 8/12.  Bond cont.  11:53 am adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 10:15 am.
